intro: Hieracium revucanum, commonly known as the Balkan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium revucanum is often found in the Balkan Peninsula and has been the subject of botanical studies due to its ecological significance and medicinal potential.
